indications: Indications adjunct in the treatment of Plasmodium vivax and P. ovale malaria (eradication of liver stages)
name: PRIMAQUINE
cautions: Cautions G6PD deficiency (test blood, see under Benign Malarias (treatment)); systemic diseases associated with granulocytopenia (e.g. rheumatoid arthritis, lupus erythematosus); interactions: Appendix 1 (primaquine)
side-effects:
Side-effects nausea, vomiting, anorexia, abdominal pain; less
commonly methaemoglobinaemia, haemolytic anaemia especially in G6PD
deficiency, leucopenia
doses: Treatment of benign malarias, see notes above
pregnancy:
Pregnancy risk of neonatal haemolysis and methaemoglobinaemia
in third trimester; see also Benign Malarias (treatment)
